Description: Whitish (worn) glazed composition amulet, pierced lengthwise, in the form of an openwork one-sided wedjat-eye within a round serrated frame.
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but possibly from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list, if not from Tell Nabasha or any other Eastern Delta site excavated by Petrie in 1886. See London, BM, EA 18515, similar.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.59, p.179, pl.21)
